org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.io

Class DhcpInterfaceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.io.DhcpInterfaceManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DhcpServer, DhcpServer

    public class DhcpInterfaceManager
extends Object
    A utility base class for DHCP server message handlers which identifies the interface on which a packet was received.
    1. Packet is received by the message handler and calls newRequestContext(java.net.InetSocketAddress, java.net.InetSocketAddress, java.net.InetSocketAddress, org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.messages.DhcpMessage).
    2. This class guesses which interface(s) the packet may have come on.
    3. This class constructs a DhcpRequestContext containing that information.
    4. The user's LeaseManager eventually calls DhcpRequestContext.setClientAddress(InetAddress).
    5. The DhcpRequestContext class refines the interface guess and permits calls to DhcpRequestContext.getInterfaceAddress().
    6. The message handler uses DhcpRequestContext.getInterfaceAddress() to update and send the new packet.
    This base class helps to work around various weaknesses with broadcast UDP in Java.
